CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, March 6, 1948, pg. 10, reads: "In Pittsburgh - A trio of feminiity 'crashed' the smoker given the publishers during their week-end meet in Pittsburgh, when Mrs. Robert L. Vann entertained for them in her Oakmont home. Pictured are, left: Mrs. William G. Black, wife of Interstate's Mr. Black; Miss Oranelle Baugh of the Houston (Texas) Informer, only feminine delegate from out of town; and Mrs. Mary McLeod Bethune, who spoke to some one thousand women the same night in a appeal to Pittsburgh women to build up their Metropolitan Council. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait from left: Mrs. William G. Black wearing moire patterned suit, Oranelle Baugh, and Mary McLeod Bethune, posed in home of Jessie Vann
